name: Buckden to Starbotton Hillside and River Walk, Upper Wharfdale

ai.summary: A demanding 23.4 km hike along the Buckden to Starbotton Hillside and River Walk in Upper Wharfedale, combining exposed hillside sections with riverbank trails. Expect long distances, significant elevation, and variable weather; suitable for experienced hikers with solid navigation and fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including rocky hillside, grassy moorland, riverbank paths, and occasional boggy sections. Expect steep ascents and descents, loose stones, and potential slips. Weather can reduce visibility and footwear grip; stay on marked paths where possible.
ai.safety_notes: This is a remote and physically demanding route: plan a long day, start early, and check weather before setting out. The Yorkshire Dales can have rapidly changing conditions, including rain, wind, fog, and cold even in summer. Carry a map and compass (do not rely solely on a phone), inform someone of your route and expected return, and bring adequate water and food. Waterproof clothing, sturdy boots, and a space blanket or emergency shelter are advised. Be cautious at river crossings and mud; avoid crossing in high water and turn back if conditions worsen.
recommended_gear: Waterproof and breathable outer layer (jacket and pants)
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone with offline maps
Adequate food and 2–3 litres of water per person
Emergency whistle and lightweight emergency shelter or bivvy
Dry bag or waterproof covers for valuables
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October) offer milder weather, longer daylight, and better trail conditions. Winter hiking increases risk from ice, deep mud, and short days; always check the forecast and be prepared for rapid weather changes.
